description: 20% Developer Decisions - Questions that require project-specific input. 80% of settings use industry defaults from bootstrap.config.

philosophy.80_percent: Industry standard defaults in bootstrap.config - never ask
philosophy.20_percent: Project-specific decisions below - must ask per project

quick_start.description: Essential questions for any project (shown in config preview)

questions.help: Used for package.json, docker-compose, database names
One-line description for package.json and README
POC=experimental, MVP=features first, Production=quality gates

technology_choices.description: Core technology decisions that affect multiple scripts

questions.help: pnpm recommended for speed and disk efficiency
Creates docker-compose.yml with database services
postgres recommended for most projects
vitest recommended for Vite/modern projects, jest for legacy
playwright recommended for modern cross-browser testing
Pre-commit linting and conventional commit enforcement

database_credentials.description: PostgreSQL database credentials (when database_type is postgres)

questions.help: Username: 3-32 chars, letters/numbers/underscore, must start with letter. Press Enter to keep default.
Press Enter to keep default. Strongly recommend changing in production.
Database name: 3-64 chars, letters/numbers/underscore, must start with letter. Press Enter to use project name.

redis_credentials.description: Redis credentials and configuration (optional, for caching/sessions)

questions.help: Press Enter to keep default. Strongly recommend changing in production.
Port for Redis service. Press Enter for default 6379, or specify alternate if already in use.

mysql_credentials.description: MySQL database credentials (optional, alternative to PostgreSQL)

questions.help: MySQL username: 3-32 chars, letters/numbers/underscore, must start with letter. Press Enter to keep default.
Press Enter to keep default. Strongly recommend changing in production.
MySQL root user password. Press Enter to keep default. Critical: Change in production.
MySQL port. Press Enter for default 3306, or specify alternate if already in use.
Cluster name: lowercase alphanumeric, hyphen, underscore. Press Enter to keep default.
Elasticsearch security password. Press Enter to keep default. Change in production.
Elasticsearch port. Press Enter for default 9200, or specify alternate if already in use.
Heap memory: use format like 512m, 1g. Default 512m for dev. Increase for production data.

email_service_credentials.description: Email service provider configuration (optional, for sending emails)

questions.help: Choose email provider. Press Enter for SendGrid.

questions.prompt: Email API key (or leave blank for SMTP)
questions.help: SendGrid/Mailgun/Postmark API key. Leave blank if using SMTP.
Email address emails will come from. Update to your domain.
Display name for sender. e.g., 'Company Name' or 'Support Team'.
SMTP username. Leave blank if using API-based provider.
SMTP password. Leave blank if using API-based provider.

oauth2_credentials.description: OAuth2/OpenID Connect authentication provider (optional, for user login)

questions.help: Choose authentication provider. Keycloak for self-hosted, Auth0/Okta for managed.
OAuth2 client ID. Ask your provider for this value. Press Enter for default.

questions.prompt: OAuth2 client secret (will be auto-generated if left blank)
questions.help: OAuth2 client secret. Leave blank to auto-generate (recommended). Get from provider if migrating.
Admin username for OAuth2 provider. Press Enter for default.
Admin password for OAuth2 provider. Press Enter for default. Change immediately in production.
OAuth2 provider port. Press Enter for default 8080, or specify alternate if already in use.

monitoring_credentials.description: Monitoring and observability provider credentials (optional, for error tracking and APM)

questions.help: Sentry captures errors and issues. Requires DSN from sentry.io account.
Sentry project DSN. Find at sentry.io after creating a project. Leave blank to skip.
Datadog provides metrics, logs, APM. Requires API key from datadog.com account.

questions.prompt: Datadog API key (leave blank to skip)
questions.help: Datadog API key. Find at organization settings in datadog.com. Leave blank to skip.
New Relic provides APM, logs, metrics. Requires license key from newrelic.com account.

questions.prompt: New Relic license key (leave blank to skip)
questions.help: New Relic license key. Find in account settings at newrelic.com. Leave blank to skip.

rate_limiting_config.description: Rate limiting configuration (optional, for API protection)

questions.prompt: Change default rate limit max requests=[100]?
questions.help: Max requests allowed per window. Press Enter for 100 requests per minute.

questions.prompt: Change default rate limit window=[60] seconds?
questions.help: Time window in seconds. Press Enter for 60 (1 minute window).
Token-bucket (recommended) or sliding-window (accurate) or fixed-window (simple).

network_vpn_credentials.description: VPN and secure networking configuration (optional, for network security)

questions.help: WireGuard (recommended - modern, faster) or OpenVPN (established, cross-platform).
VPN network CIDR block. Default 10.0.0.0/24. Change if conflicts with existing networks.
VPN port (51820 for WireGuard, 1194 for OpenVPN). Adjust if already in use.
How many peer configurations to generate for multi-node setups. Default: 5 peers.
DNS servers to use (comma-separated). Default: Google Public DNS.

backup_credentials.description: Backup and disaster recovery configuration (optional, for data protection)

questions.help: Restic (recommended - fast, secure) or Duplicati (UI) or Bacula (enterprise).
S3/S3-compatible (recommended), B2 (cheap), Azure, Google Cloud, or local disk.

questions.prompt: S3 bucket name (leave blank if not using S3)
questions.help: S3 bucket for backups. Can be AWS S3, DigitalOcean Spaces, or Backblaze B2 S3 API.
AWS region (us-east-1, eu-west-1, etc.) or endpoint URL for S3-compatible services.
How long to keep backups (30 days = monthly, 90 days = quarterly, 365+ for long-term).

questions.prompt: Change default backup schedule=[daily at 2 AM]?
questions.help: Cron format (0 2 * * * = 2 AM daily). Change for different schedule.
Encryption protects backup data in transit and at rest. Strongly recommended.
Directories/services to backup (comma-separated). Include all critical data.

sandbox_options.description: Docker sandbox (single container for app + Postgres + Redis)

questions.prompt: App port to expose on the host
questions.help: Bridge networking maps this port to the host so you can hit the dev server via host IP

questions.prompt: Mount host Docker socket? (enables Docker-in-Docker workflows)
questions.help: Mounting /var/run/docker.sock grants the container control of your host Docker daemon

questions.prompt: Mount host SSH keys for git access?
questions.help: Mounting ~/.ssh and ~/.gitconfig lets git inside the container use your host credentials

dev_options.description: Docker Tier 2 Dev (single container, hardened vs sandbox)

questions.prompt: App port to expose on the host
questions.help: Bridge networking maps this port to the host so you can hit the dev server via host IP
Expose Node inspector for attaching debuggers

questions.prompt: Mount host Docker socket? (for Docker-in-Docker workflows)
questions.help: Mounting /var/run/docker.sock grants the container control of your host Docker daemon

questions.prompt: Mount host SSH keys for git access?
questions.help: Mounting ~/.ssh and ~/.gitconfig lets git inside the container use your host credentials

questions.prompt: Container user ID (match your host uid for bind mounts)
questions.help: Helps avoid file permission mismatches when mounting the repo

questions.prompt: Container group ID (match your host gid for bind mounts)
questions.help: Helps avoid file permission mismatches when mounting the repo

questions.prompt: App port to expose on the host
questions.help: Bridge networking maps this port to the host; keep minimal exposure

questions.prompt: Postgres password (required, will also be written to secret file)
Redis password (required, will also be written to secret file)
Mount host Docker socket? (avoid in prod)
questions.help: Mounting /var/run/docker.sock grants the container control of your host Docker daemon

questions.prompt: Mount host SSH keys for git access? (avoid in prod)
questions.help: Mounting ~/.ssh and ~/.gitconfig lets the container use your host credentials; avoid in prod

Default: 20 LTS (recommended for production)
